definition: yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
pork strips stir-fried with yuxiang 魚香|鱼香[yu2 xiang1]

sentences.english: The effection of volatile aroma compound was emphasized here.
sentences.chinese: 着重论述了多种鱼香挥发性化合物的作用。

sentences.english: Tianwu:Flavored pork, though named fish-flavored but not fish, is a practice Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 虽名为鱼香但并没有鱼肉，是川菜的一种做法。

definition: pork strips stir-fried with yuxiang 魚香|鱼香[yu2 xiang1]
Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
mapo tofu/stir-fried beancurd in chili sauce
five spice seasoned/incorporating the five basic flavors of Chinese cooking (sweet, sour, bitter, savory, salty)
to stir-fry with oil only (no addition of water)
hot and sour soup/sour and spicy soup
